net.sf.marineapi.nmea.sentence
Interface DateSentence

All Superinterfaces:
Sentence
All Known Subinterfaces:
RMCSentence, ZDASentence
public interface DateSentence
extends Sentence

Common interface for sentences that contain UTC date information. Notice that some sentences contain only time without date information.

Version:
$Revision: 23 $
Author:
Kimmo Tuukkanen
See Also:
TimeSentence

Field Detail

PIVOT_YEAR

static final int PIVOT_YEAR
A pivot year that is used to determine century for a two-digit year values. Two-digit values lower than or equal to pivot year are assigned to 21th century, while values greater than pivot are assigned to 20th century.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getDate

java.util.Date getDate()
Parses the date information in a Date object. Sub-second precision may be provided by some sentences, but generally the precision is by 1 second.

Returns:
Date
Throws:
DataNotAvailableException - If the data is not available.
ParseException - If the field contains unexpected or illegal value.

getUtcDay

int getUtcDay()
Get day of UTC date.

Returns:
integer
Throws:
DataNotAvailableException - If the data is not available.
ParseException - If the field contains unexpected or illegal value.

getUtcMonth

int getUtcMonth()
Get month of UTC date.

Returns:
integer
Throws:
DataNotAvailableException - If the data is not available.
ParseException - If the field contains unexpected or illegal value.

getUtcYear

int getUtcYear()
Get year of UTC date. The date fields in NMEA 0183 may contain two-digit value for year. If this is the case, then the century is determined by comparing the two-digit value against PIVOT_YEAR. Values lower than or equal to pivot are added to 2000, while values greater than pivot are added to 1900.

Returns:
Four-digit year
Throws:
DataNotAvailableException - If the data is not available.
ParseException - If the field contains unexpected or illegal value.
